title: Doc Path Option
body:
### Component

Forge

### Describe the feature you would like

It'd be great to have a `path` option under the `[doc]` section that specifies the path in the repository the package exists


### Additional context

I'm trying to generate docs here synapsecns/sanguine#1338 and the path to the foundry package is `package/contracts-core` and am unable to get the git links working correctly.

So far, I've tried:

- adding a `book.toml ` to `./book.toml` https://github.com/synapsecns/sanguine/pull/1338/commits/85455ab978671ca5671bedb7d766243629c71adb which resulted in [example[(https://sanguine-contract-docs-ie5l6g0xp-synapsecns.vercel.app/contracts/Origin.sol/contract.Origin.html)
- Overriding the `book.toml` as a whole in https://github.com/synapsecns/sanguine/pull/1338/commits/15db5e2b5de0822c99dbffce2bd10419eec9c59c resulting in [example[(https://sanguine-contract-docs-fsfudg0wp-synapsecns.vercel.app/contracts/Origin.sol/contract.Origin.html)
- Adding the path in the `foundry.toml` here https://github.com/synapsecns/sanguine/pull/1338/commits/24286de0ec1bf080d5bc872e44f8b5247b5cb756 which resulted in [example](https://sanguine-contract-docs-l4kxfl9zl-synapsecns.vercel.app/)

Appreciate it
